project.teaser: The RE-SKIN project aims at developing an integrated and multifunctional system for energy retrofit of existing buildings, organised in two main subsystems, roof and faade, combined with the building's HVAC system. The roof is equipped with a hybrid photovoltaic-thermal...
project.objective: The RE-SKIN project aims at developing an integrated and multifunctional system for energy retrofit of existing buildings, organised in two main subsystems, roof and faade, combined with the building's HVAC system. The roof is equipped with a hybrid photovoltaic-thermal system, which produces electricity and heat and at the same time thermally and acoustically insulates the slab beneath. Electricity, from retrofitted photovoltaic modules, powers the building's loads, which interacts with the grid and EV charging stations. Heat is used by a heat pump for heating and hot water preparation. Solar modules form the outer skin of the roof and replace traditional materials such as tiles and sheets. Through a special treatment, they can take on different colours, depending on the aesthetic and architectural identity of the building. The faade is a thermal cladding with self-supporting panels and bio-based insulation, optimised for quick assembly without scaffolding, inside which the wiring for the new installations and earthquake sensors are housed. Retrofit techniques/components of existing windows are also included. Both the roof and the faade are particularly resistant to weather and extreme climatic phenomena, as they use materials that are more resistant and waterproof than traditional ones. The HVAC system consists of a solar-assisted DC air-water heat pump, connected to smart-fancoils, which are designed to be connected to the buildings heating piping, but can provide both heating and cooling. The whole system is designed according to a circular economy logic, using mostly recycled/bio-based/repurposed/refurbished materials, and is supported by a lifecycle cloud-based DSS and energy management tool, in order to maximise energy performance while reducing environmental impacts. The system can be applied all over Europe, as it provides renewable energy and participates actively and passively in the energy performance of buildings, both in summer and winter.
project.title: Renewable and Environmental-Sustainable Kit for building INtegration
project.keywords: Circular economy, resilient buildings, energy renovation, renewable energy sources, biosourced and recycled materials, refurbished and repurposed components, hybrid technical solutions

article.title: New roof and façade for energy-efficient buildings

result.title: Dissemination and communication strategy and plan I
result.description: The document is the first version of the Communication & Dissemination Strategy (T10.1-T10.3). The document will guide for all dissemination and communication activities throughout the duration of the project. The strategy contains the description of the activities included in the dissemination and communications plan, including a detailed plan for demonstration activities. The indicator of success is the completeness of the plan its meeting KPIs and targets set in the strategy.

result.title: Methodology to test the reliability of subsystems I
result.description: The deliverable aims to define the scenarios of the external agents and actions to be assumed for the setup of the laboratory test, the testing procedures to be applied for the laboratory test of systems and components reliability and will provide criteria and methods to interpret the laboratory test results (T3.1). The indicator of success is the comprehensiveness in respect to RE-SKIN components.

result.title: Optimized technical specifications of each component I
result.description: This deliverable contains the first release of the optimized technical specification of each component of the toolkit (T4.1). In detail, the features of the components/solutions of each consortium partner, which represent the baseline for the development of the toolkit, must be reported. The indicator of success is to provide all the required data (for each component) in a common datasheet format in order to collect all the basic information needed within a standardized framework.

result.title: Project management and quality Plan I
result.description: The scope of this deliverable is to preliminary define all key procedures related to project scientific/administrative management and quality assurance and control (T1.1 and 1.2) such as the project organization strategy, the procedures, the roles and responsibilities related to project and quality management, etc. The indication of success is the comprehensiveness/clarity of the procedures according to what established in the Grant Agreement.

result.title: Requirements to optimize resilience and maintenance I
result.description: The deliverable provides a set of maintainability factors that shall be used during the basic design stage for the whole system configuration and during detailed design (or procurement) of the main sub-components (T3.1-T3.2). The deliverable will also include a specific procedure to perform maintainability reviews during the design process at appropriate stages.

result.title: Manufacturing design of the multifunctional façade cladding I
result.description: The document provides the first version of the specification of the manufacturing design of the multifunctional façade cladding and the results of preliminary pilot testing (T5.1), preparatory to application in the first case study. The indicator of success is the completeness of the technical specification and the successfulness of first testing activities.

result.title: Manufacturing design of the technical components I
result.description: The document provides the first version of the specification of the manufacturing design of the technical systems and the results of preliminary pilot testing (T6.1-T6.5), preparatory to application in the first case study. The indicator of success is the completeness of the technical specification and the successfulness of first testing activities.

result.title: Optimized installation and disassembly procedures I
result.description: The document aims to provide the first version of the decommissioning and disassembly procedures of every package’s component (T4.4 and T4.5). The indicator of success will be the establishment of improved technical specifications for each component of the system.

result.title: Verification of the final configuration of the system I
result.description: The aim of the document is to provide an updated simulation about the interaction and the behaviour of the entire system (T4.3) once RE-SKIN subcomponents have been further optimized and tested individually. The indicator of success is the positive result of the simulations in respect to the expected system performances.

result.title: Application context periodic update I
result.description: The aim of the document is to provide the first periodic update of the application context in the target countries (T2.1-2.4) and the results of the site risk assessment (T2.6). The indicator of success is to give a comprehensive overview of all the key elements of the context (e.g. retrofit market status, regulatory framework, etc.) and of the site risk assessment (e.g. multihazard and multirisk assessment maps) for every target country of the application context.

result.title: Energy audits and surveys I
result.description: The aim of the document is to provide a comprehensive energy audit of the pre-retrofit state of the first case study building as wall as an overall survey of its architectonical and technical systems features (T8.1). The indicator of success is the full completion of the audit and survey phase.document contains the results of the energy audits before the retrofit interventions.

result.title: Final design of the renovation intervention I
result.description: The deliverable aims to provide the set of design documentation required to authorize and perform the retrofit work on the first case study (T8.2). The indicator of success is the full completion of the necessary documentation (descriptive reports, drawings, bill of materials, etc.).

result.title: Manufacturing design of the multifunctional façade cladding II
result.description: The document provides the second version of the specification of the manufacturing design of the multifunctional faade cladding and the results of pilot testing (T5.1), preparatory to application in the second case study. The indicator of success is the completeness of the technical specification and the successfulness of first testing activities.

result.title: Technical components for on-field demonstration I
result.description: The aim of the deliverable is to describe the final technical systems manufactured for the demonstration phase in the first case study (T6.1-T6.5). The indicator of success is the completion of the manufacturing process for all needed components.

result.title: Implementing Smart Readiness in existing buildings: the RE-SKIN project case study

details.authors: Niccolò Aste, Claudio Del Pero, Fabrizio Leonforte, Harold Enrique Huerto Cardenas
details.journalTitle: 2025 International Conference on Clean Electrical Power (ICCEP)

result.title: Project management and quality Plan II
result.description: The scope of this deliverable is to update key procedures related to project scientific/administrative management and quality assurance and control (T1.1 and 1.2) such as the project organization strategy, the procedures, the roles and responsibilities related to project and quality management, etc. The indication of success is the comprehensiveness/clarity of the procedures and the evidence of smooth advancement of the project according to what established in the Grant Agreement.

result.title: Building energy retrofit: a multi-technology and low-impact renovation package

details.authors: H. E. Huerto-Cardenas, N. Aste, C. Del Pero, F. Leonforte, F. Asvadi
details.journalTitle: 2025 International Conference on Clean Electrical Power (ICCEP)

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - RE-SKIN (Renewable and Environmental-Sustainable Kit for building INtegration)
result.teaser: RE-SKIN aims to enhance total energy and environmental efficiency in the building sector, intensively applying at the same time the life cycle sustainability and circular economy principles. At a glance, the project is expected to develop and demonstrate an integrated...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Optimized technical specifications of each component II
result.description: This deliverable contains the update of the the optimized technical specification of each component of the toolkit (T4.1). Starting from the features of the components/solutions of each consortium partner that have been reported in D4.1, which represent the baseline for the development of the toolkit, the technical specifications of each new or updated element are defined. The indicator of success is the update of all the required data (for each component) in a common datasheet format in order to collect all the basic information needed within a standardized framework.

category.title: sensors
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/electrical engineering, electronic engineering, information engineering/electronic engineering/sensors

category.title: electric power transmission
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/electrical engineering, electronic engineering, information engineering/electrical engineering/power engineering/electric power transmission

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
